page.title: 08ROAD MAINTENANCE DEPOT
page.content: There is a Hampshire County Council road depot next to Hounsdown School. The site was opened as a road depot in the mid nineteen thirties. It covers an area of six acres. Twenty four men work there eight hours a day. The grit, gravel, salt and other equipment is supplied to the depot by the Department of the Environment. This particular depot covers most of South West Hampshire and in one day, five trucks carrying twenty tons of salt or gravel or grit unload. During the winter extra men are hired if the weather is bad. The road depot is also responsible for grass cutting on the road verges as well as school playing fields and public parks. Most of the area is used for storage but there are offices, machine sheds, workshops and garages on the site.
